result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Robert Olson

records.addlTxt: $500 cash bond to cover warrants in Burnett County cases 22CF24, 19CF251, and 18CF207.  Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

09:14 AM Cases 21TR940, 18CF207, 19CF251, and 22CF24 called together.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for defendant.  Defendant fails to appear by any means.  State requests to default 21TR940; forfeit any cash posted, and for warrants in the criminal matters.  Atty Otten stands mute.  Court orders warrant in criminal files $500 cash, only judge may quash; finds def in default for FTA in 21TR940, assesses $175.30 to be paid within 30 days and def to provide fingerprints in the files that need them.
Status conference on April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:10 PM Cases 22CF24, 21TR940, 18CF207, and 19CF251 called together.  Defendant, John Robert Olson, appeared with Attorney Alysja Otten.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Cases 21TR940, 18CF207, and 19CF251 on for status conferences.  Case 22CF24 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Atty Otten has leave to file any motions until next status.  Case proceeds to arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No driving without a valid driver's license.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

Preliminary hearing on March 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:17 PM Cases 22CF24 and 21TR940 called together. Defendant, John Robert Olson, appeared.  Atty. James Jay Rennicke appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin. Cases on for an Initial Appearance.  Def enters NG plea to TR matter.  Def intends to apply for PD.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Court notes warrants in two older files (19CF251 and 18CF207) are active.  Def enters NG plea to misdemeanor.  WTLPH Court addresses defendant about the active warrants; defendant responds.  Court quashes the warrants in 19CF251 and 18CF207.  Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints.  Court orders bond to cover all cases, $1000 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
